newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Arnotts says financial impact unclear.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Arnotts says financial impact unclear.

text.p: Australian bakery group Arnotts Ltd said on Friday that the financial impact resulting from the removal of its products from supermarket shelves after an extortion threat depended on the length of the recall.

"Clearly there will be a cost," Arnotts chief executive Chris Roberts told a news conference. "The extent of that cost will be determined by the period that our products will be off the shelves in New South Wales and Queensland."
Roberts said exports would not be affected the recall, which affected only Queensland and New South Wales.
"There won't be any impact on exports," he said.
Roberts said the evidence showed clearly that the threat only related to products in the two states.
Arnotts, which is about 70 percent owned by Campbell Soup Co , exports biscuits (cookies) to New Zealand and Asia.
